wikipedia_page.main: Ron Morrison was the head of School of the computer science department of the University of St. Andrews where he worked on programming languages, inventing S-algol, and coinventing PS-algol and Napier88. He had graduated from St. Andrews with a Doctor of Philosophy (Ph.D.) in 1979. He is also heavily involved with local athletics, coaching the University Cross-Country team, and young, up and coming local athletes. He is a Fellow of the Royal Society of Edinburgh, and the current President of Scottish Athletics.He retired from St. Andrews in January 2008.

response: |S-algol|| 1979 || Ron Morrison || UK || Addition of orthogonal datatypes with intended use as a teaching language || PDP-11 with a subsequent implementation on the Java VM
